title: KNOSSIA
content:
KNOSSIA (Cnossia) was the Naiad-nymph of a spring or fountain of the town of Knossos (Cnossus) in Krete
        (Crete). She was seduced by King Menelaos (Menelaus) of Sparta during a visit to the island.

XENODAMOS (by Menelaos) (Eumelus Frag, Apollodorus 3.133)

Pseudo-Apollodorus, Bibliotheca 3. 133 (trans. Aldrich) (Greek mythographer C2nd
          A.D.) :
        "Eumelos [poet C8th B.C.] says he [Menelaos] also sired Xenodamos (Xenodamus) with a Nymphe named Knossia
        (Cnossia)."

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
